answerText: Pharsalia[10] The Pharsalia was penned by this Roman poet and member of the Pisonian conspiracy, who's only other extant work is a poetic praise of Nero.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Brown University and Notre Dame | 8 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This work consists of ten books, and book two has a long flashback to the conflict between Gauis Marius and Sulla. FTPE: [10] Name this epic about the civil war between Julius Ceaser and Pompey, that was left unfinished at the author's death. It begins with a praise of Nero, and ends with Caesar in Egypt.
